name: Eagle Eye
text: Scout 3 path cards, then draw 1 path card.
flavor: When you were young, you and your father would climb the Mound of the Navigator and look over the Valley. From that high vantage, he taught you to see the subtlest movements and minute detail of the flora and fauna far below.

name: Paths We’ve Roamed Before
text: Choose up to 4 total moments or attributes from any number of Ranger discards. Place the chosen cards facedown on the top of their Ranger’s fatigue stack.
flavor: As you walk the Valley, you recall the wisdom gained during the seasonal wanderings of your youth.

name: Strider
text: You can only commit this attribute when interacting with a trail.
flavor: From the day you took your first steps, you haven't stopped moving. Your heart yearns to scale distant peaks and wander untrodden vistas. You continually look toward the horizon, never content to sit still.

name: Trail Mix
text: Exhaust (use 1 morsel): Choose a Ranger. That Ranger soothes fatigue equal to the number of [FIT] in their energy pool.
flavor: It's a delicious medley of cherry moss pemmican, marbled great beans, starpeas, almonds, and a few surprises.

name: Perfect Recall
text:
Play a moment from your discard pile without paying its energy cost (X is equal to the chosen moment’s cost).
This card can be played at the time specified on the chosen moment.

name: Reverb Locket
text: When you play this gear, attach a moment to it from your hand. Exhaust (use 1 echo): Play the attached moment as if it were in your hand. It remains attached to this gear instead of being discarded.

name: Adaptable Multitool
text: Exhaust (use 1 charge): Spend 1 energy to gain 1 energy of any type.
flavor: There's no better companion than a memlev multitool. It's like having an artificer's workshop in the palm of your hand, but not nearly as heavy.

name: Ironwool Boots
text: Unique. Response: After you play a moment, soothe 1 fatigue.
flavor: Your mother taught you many things as you walked by her side, trekking across the Valley and back, but of all her teachings, none were more useful than this: always wear comfortable shoes.

name: Meditation Pillow
text: [FOC] + [connection] (use 1 session): Meditate on your journey to shuffle a number of cards from your fatigue stack into your Ranger deck equal to your effort.
flavor: You feel that quiet meditation is essential to daily life, and that the ability to enjoy moments of stillness is paramount to one's well-being.

name: The Right Tool
text: Choose a ranger. That ranger may discard one of their equipped gear to search their ranger deck for a gear and equip it without paying its energy cost.
flavor: Your mother taught you how to work with a great number of tools, and from her you gained an intimate knowledge of their function and practical application.

name: Pocketed Belt Pouch
text: Reduce the equip value of your gear by 1 (to a minimum of 1). [AWA] + [reason] use 1 pocket: Open your belt pouch and reach inside to search your Ranger deck for a gear and add it to your hand.

name: The Mother of Invention
text: Choose an attachment in a Ranger’s discard. That Ranger may immediately play that attachment as if it were in their hand.
flavor: You know that inspiration does not simply come when called. When it strikes, you must act.

name: Moment of Desperation
text: Discard one of your equipped gear to add [harm] to a being equal to the number of tokens on the discarded gear.
flavor: You'll never forget the look on your brother's face we he saw that raccoon out of the corner of his eye, believing it was a bearsloth. You also remember the raccoon, struck by a belt pouch, yet unperturbed.

name: Masterwork
text: Attach to a Ranger’s equipped gear. Response: When a Ranger performs a test from the attached gear, commit 1 effort.
flavor: During your apprenticeship at the carbon forge, you learned much from Elder Orlin.

name: Universal Power Cells
text: Attach to a Ranger’s equipped tech. When you play this attachment, add 3 tokens to the attached gear. Response: When this card becomes unattached, discard 3 tokens from the attached gear.

name: Functional Replica
text: Exhaust (use 1 charge): Choose a Ranger’s equipped gear. Resolve the chosen gear’s effect as if you had used a token from it and/or exhausted it.
flavor: So you would discover the artistry in even the simplest of objects, your mentor encouraged you to mimic the work of master craftspeople.

name: Favorite Gear
text: Attach to one of your equipped gear. Response: After you use a token from the attached gear, soothe 1 fatigue.
flavor: When you are at work, you are at peace, and when you work with your favorite gear, you are filled with a deep sense of purpose, fully in the moment and alive.

name: Energized Hiking Greaves
text: Use X buffers: When you perform a test, suffer X fewer fatigue from each card between you and the card with which you are interacting.
flavor: You crafted these hiking greaves from dolewood bark, overlaid them with a veneer of forged carbon, then applied a kinesthetic lining as the finishing touch.

name: One Eye Open
text: Response: When you rest, exhaust up to one being for each [AWA] in your energy pool.
flavor: While tending your flock of ironwool sheep, under the sun and moon, you learned the importance of staying alert, even when all seems still.

name: Riri the Sparrow Hawk
text: Friendly. Persistent. Unique. Exhaust: Add 1[harm] to a being in the same area as this companion. [AWA] + [reason]: Survey the way ahead to scout path cards equal to your effort, then draw 1 path card.

name: A Gentle Nudge
text: Each Ranger may discard 1[progress] from a being within reach of them to move that being.
flavor: You've spent countless days, year after year, in relative solitude, alone but for your flock. In that time you've learned that any being can be reasoned with. You just need to ask nicely (and put your back into it).

name: Homeward Bound
text: Move all [progress] from a being to a feature.
flavor: Your uncle loves to regale any who'll listen with the Tale of the Shepherd and the Relgerbeast. The shepherd in the tale saves his flock not by harming the beast, but by riding it back to the village. It then becomes a valued member of the community, rooting out Scrofs in the field.

name: Paratrepsis Whistle
text: Exhaust (use 1 call): When a Ranger would suffer an injury from a predator or [harm] would be added to a being by a predator, cancel that effect.
flavor: You were gifted this whistle during a brief summer romance, and each time you blow it, you're reminded of a flower-scented breeze beneath a high, glimmering sun.

name: A Deeper Understanding
text: Choose a being. Move [progress] from the chosen being to each other card in play, up to 1[progress] per card.
flavor: In your solitude, you once observed the wind describing its course across the plain and came to a place of peace. You saw your life as the wind, ephemeral and beautiful, and you were grateful for it.

name: Healing Touch
text: Choose one: Discard 1[harm] from a being to add 3[progress] to it. Heal 1 injury from a Ranger.
flavor: The spirit speaker of Meadow mentored you in the healing arts of your ancestors. You have never forgotten those lessons.

name: Calming Presence
text: Attach to a predator. Attached card loses the predator trait. Response: Before a challenge effect on the attached card would resolve, you may discard 2[progress] from it to cancel the effect.

name: Oru the Sheep Dog
text: Friendly. Persistent. Unique. Exhaust: Move a being and add 2[progress] to it. [FIT] + [connection]: Pet your canine companion to ready this being and soothe 1 fatigue.

name: Green Thumb
text:
Search the path deck and discard for a flora and put it into play with this skill attached.
Increase the attached flora’s [harm] threshold by 2.

name: Local Fare
text: Response: When a Ranger performs a test, they may add 1[harm] to a flora to dodge each being in the same area as that flora.
flavor: Your great aunt taught you that when the artilope are in the field, the way through the forest becomes clear.

name: Puffercrawler Spores
text: Attach to any Ranger’s equipped gear. Response: When you add [harm] to a being with the attached gear, exhaust that being and attach this card to it. The attached being gains the flora trait.

name: Familiar Ground
text: Add 1 [harm] to a flora to add 3 [progress] to a trail.
flavor: During family foraging excursions, your parents would call your attention to subtle passages created by sitka deer. These convenient shortcuts led to many fruit-bearing plants like sunberry brambles and cherry moss.

name: Carbonforged Trowel
text: [SPI] + [reason]: Tend to the local plants to add or remove [harm] from a flora equal to your effort. [FIT] + [conflict]: Strike [2] out with your gardening tool to add 1[harm] to a being for every 2 effort. If you fail, suffer 1 injury.

name: Secret Garden
text:
Attach to a feature.
Attached feature gains the flora trait.
flavor: You grew up exploring the Valley's hidden places, where miniature ecologies thrive in the secluded glades, and dolewood stumps shelter life in abundance.

name: Loose-Leaf Tea Kit
text: Response: After you add 1 or more [harm] to a flora, you may add 1 herb to this gear. Exhaust (use 1 herb): Choose a Ranger. That Ranger gains 1 energy of any type.

name: Nature's Abundance
text: Each Ranger may add 1 [harm] to a flora to soothe 1 fatigue and gain 1 energy of any type. When you add [harm] to a flora in this way, you may not exceed its [harm] threshold.
flavor: Your summers spent sifting sunberries in the shade of the cedars has led to a deep affinity for the freshest of fruits.

name: Static Sifter
text: Response: After you add 1 or more [harm] to a flora, you may add 1 vittle to this gear. Exhaust (use 1 vittle): Choose a Ranger. That Ranger soothes 2 fatigue.
flavor: When held near a fruit-bearing plant, the sifter comes to life, crackling with energy as it attracts the plant's ripened bounty.

name: Undaunted Seeker
text: Exhaust: When you perform a test, dodge 1 card.

name: Peerless Pathfinder
text: Exhaust: Move your [ranger] to a feature. That feature fatigues you.

name: A Leaf in the Breeze
text: Response: When you Traverse, dodge up to 3 cards.
flavor: You sense the flow of energy in the life around you and heed its subtle cues as you pass unnoticed along your path.

name: Hydrolens Goggles
text: [AWA] + [reason] (use 1 drop): Clarify your view of the environment around you to scout path cards equal to your effort, then draw 1 path card.
flavor: You depress the applicator, and one small drop of water bubbles and expands to form a single clarifying lens.

name: Share in the Valley’s Secrets
text: Exhaust each obstacle. Suffer fatigue equal to the number of obstacles exhausted this way.
flavor: Your mentor once took you into the hills beyond Lone Tree, blindfolded, and had you lead the way home in the night, with only the stars to guide you.

name: Boundary Sensor
text: Exhaust (use 1 sensor): When a Ranger performs a Traverse test, commit 1 effort.
flavor: A soft hum briefly emits from the device, and you suddenly feel more confident in your steps, certain of the way forward.

name: Orlin Hiking Stave
text: Exhaust (use 1 stride): Add 1[progress] to a trail. [FIT] + [conflict]: Strike [2] out with your walking implement to add 1[harm] to a being for every 2 effort. If you fail, suffer 1 injury.

name: Afforded by Nature
text: Discard any number of [progress] from a trail to add an equal number of [harm] to a being.
flavor: You've learned from experience that sometimes a persistent predator can only be dissuaded from its meal by a faceful of rocks or a decaying log suddenly dropped in its path.

name: Phonoscopic Headset
text: Exhaust: When a Ranger scouts, increase the number of cards scouted by 1.
flavor: You tap the sensor at your temple, and sight and sound converge to evoke a scene in your mind beyond what your ears and eyes can normally comprehend.

name: Field Journal
text: Response: When you rest, add entries equal to the number of [FOC] in your energy pool. Use 1 entry: When a Ranger interacts with a feature, commit 1 effort.

name: Hidden Trail
text: Response: When you travel, if this trail is attached to the location, travel to a location up to two paths away. Use the terrain of the second path when building the path deck. Clear [progress]: Attach this trail to the location.

name: Walk With Me
text: Response: After you succeed at a Traverse test, add [progress] to a being equal to your effort. This is in addition to the test’s standard effect.
flavor: Through practice and intention, you've learned to show others the vastness of possibility before them. There are no limits save the ones we place on ourselves.

name: Breathe Into It
text: Response: When you perform a test, discard any number of cards from your fatigue stack to commit 1 effort to that test for every 2 cards discarded this way.

name: Cradled by the Earth
text: Choose a trail. Soothe fatigue equal to the number of [progress] on that trail. This fatigue may be divided as you choose between all Rangers.
flavor: You lie back and breathe deep. In this moment you are keenly aware of your connection to the earth and to all living things.

name: Masterful Engineer
text: Exhaust: Ready a tech.

name: Exceptional Tinkerer
text: Exhaust: Spend 1 energy to add 1 token to a tech.

name: Ferinodex
text: Exhaust (use 1 profile): When a Ranger performs an Avoid test, commit 1 effort.
flavor: The telescopic sensor extending from the spine identifies nearby fauna then reveals information regarding their biology and behavior from within the tome.

name: Carbonforged Cable
text: Attach to a predator. Use 1 length: When the attached predator would ready, it remains exhausted. [FIT] + [conflict]: Lead the animal to move the attached predator.

name: Dayhowler
text: Discard this gear from play to exhaust beings equal to the number of charges on this gear. Response: After you succeed at an Avoid test, add 1 charge to this gear.

name: Trail Markers
text: Attach to a location or feature. The attached card gains the trail trait. Response: When 1 or more [progress] is added to the attached trail, increase the number of [progress] added by 1.

name: Spiderpad Gloves
text: During your turn, you may treat obstacles as if they did not have the obstacle keyword. [FIT] + [reason] (use 1 charge): Climb the obstructing terrain with the agility of a spider to move your [ranger] to an obstacle.

name: Wrist-mounted Darter
text: [FOC] + [conflict] (use 1 dart): Shoot one of the featherlight darts to add [harm] to a being equal to your effort. Whether you succeed or fail, dodge all cards between you and that being.

name: Infusion Canteen
text: When you play this gear, choose an aspect (you may place a spare energy token here as a reminder). Exhaust (use 1 sip): Gain 1 energy matching the chosen aspect.

name: Memorill Sketchpad
text: Response: After a path card is cleared, add 1 inkrill to this gear. Use 1 inkrill: When a Ranger interacts with a feature, commit 1 effort.

name: Memlev Trekking Poles
text: Exhaust (use 1 charge): When you perform a Traverse test, use [FOC] instead of [FIT].
flavor: With each step, your trekking poles spring upward, easing your burden as they provide buoyancy to your limbs.

name: A Stone in the River
text: Response: After you succeed at an Avoid test, exhaust 1 additional being
flavor: Whether in your workshop or in nature, you are able to reach a state of being where you are at one with with your surroundings, moving with an ease that suggests an intrinsic understanding of creation.

name: Camoweave Cloak
text: Use 1 charge: When you would suffer 1 or more fatigue from a path card, reduce the fatigue suffered to 0.
flavor: With a clockwise rotation of the clasp, the surface of the cloak adopts the patterns and coloration of your environment, making you all but invisible to the untrained eye.

name: Thoroughly Prepared
text: Reponse: When a Ranger would suffer 1 or more fatigue, they soothe that amount of fatigue instead.
flavor: You never leave your workshop without the tools essential to survival in the wilderness.The right tool can turn even the most exhausting of endeavors into a moment of exhilaration.

name: Guardian
text: Exhaust: Reduce a being’s presence to 0 until the end of the turn.

name: Voice of the Elders
text: Exhaust: Spend 1 energy to add 1 token to an aid card.

name: Surveyed Land
text:
Attach to a feature.
Reduce the attached feature’s presence by 1 for each marker on this attachment.

name: Tranquilisnare
text:
Attach to a being.
Reduce the attached being’s presence by 1 for each snare on this attachment.
flavor: The mesh of interlocking snares hums with a gentle, harmonic energy that can soothe even the most aggressive of beings.

name: One With Nature
text: Reduce the presence of each card in play to 0 until the end of the next turn.
flavor: For years you've preserved the harmony of your village by not only fostering love and compassion in your community, but by spending time in the surrounding mountains and forests, connecting with the natural world.

name: Follow in Footsteps
text: Response: After you succeed at a Connect test, add [progress] to a feature equal to your effort. This is in addition to the test’s standard effect.
flavor: You believe that greater understanding and insight can always be reached if you spend time following in the footsteps of those who came before.

name: Orlin Thumper
text: [FIT] + [conflict] (use 1 pulse): Strike [2] with a pulse of kinetic energy to add 1[harm] to a being and exhaust it. If you fail, discard 1[progress] from that being; if you cannot, it fatigues you instead.

name: Tracked
text: Attach to a being. Response: After a challenge effect on the attached being resolves, add 1 track. Use 1 track: When a Ranger performs a test, commit 1 effort.

name: Intention Translator
text: Exhaust (use 1 charge): When a Ranger performs a Connect test, commit 1 effort.
flavor: When this device is activated, you feel somehow incapable of misunderstanding those around you. Each word and gesture conveys a purity of thought perceivable by only the most empathetic of beings.

name: Safeguard
text: Response: When a Ranger would suffer an injury or [harm] would be added to a being, cancel that effect. Suffer 1 injury.
flavor: You are selfless in your defense of others, knowing that all wounds are temporary, and the scars you carry are reminders of your sworn duty.

name: Nidocyte Sentinel
text: Attach to a being. Use 1 alarm: When a challenge effect on the attached being would resolve, cancel that effect.
flavor: A small ceramic device worn at your waist sends a pulse of energy to your chest, altering you to potential dangers.

name: Ancestral Teachings
text: Exhaust a being. Then add [progress] to that being equal to the number of exhausted beings within reach.
flavor: Our ancestors hold a wealth of knowledge and experience. To venture forth into life as paupers is both foolish and unnecessary. With their help we may preserve that which they've gifted to us and prosper.

name: Pokodo the Ferret
text: Friendly. Persistent. Unique. Exhaust: Discard 1[progress] from this being to add 1 token to an aid card and 2[progress] to another being.
flavor: Pokodo is unswervingly loyal and adored by all who meet her.

name: A Dear Friend
text: Search the path deck and discard for a human and put them into play with this card attached. Response: When the attached human is cleared, move the [progress] from it to any number of other beings, divided as you choose

name: Adherent of the First Ideal
text: Exhaust: Scout 1 challenge card.

name: Prodigy of the Floating Tower
text: Exhaust: Choose a manifestation in your discard, and add it to your hand.

name: Root Snare
text: Manifestation. Attach to a feature, and add 2[progress] to it. Response: When a Ranger performs a test, they may discard 1 or more [progress] from the attached feature to dodge an equal number of cards in the same area.

name: Sky Whip
text: Manifestation. (To play a manifestation, discard 1 token from a conduit.) [AWA] + [conflict]: Strike with a whirling coil of wind and water to add [harm] to a being equal to your effort. Then exhaust that being.

name: Stave of the Sun
text: Conduit. Setup. Response: After the challenge deck is shuffled, add 1 glint to this conduit. Exhaust (use X glints): Scout X path cards.

name: What Should Never Be
text: Manifestation. Response: When drawing challenge cards during a test, draw and discard challenge cards until you draw one with a +1 in the used aspect. Use that challenge card for this test, and suffer fatigue equal the number of cards discarded this way.

name: Shape the Earth
text:
Manifestation. <f>(To play a manifestation, discard 1 token from a conduit.)</f>
Add 1[progress] to each feature and location. Then you may redistribute any number of [progress] between them.

name: Staff of the Wanderer
text: Conduit. Setup. Response: After you succeed at a Traverse test, add 1 stride to this conduit. Exhaust (use X strides): Add X[progress] to a trail.

name: Throng of Life
text: Manifestation. (To play a manifestation, discard 1 token from a conduit.) Response: When a Ranger reveals a challenge card during a test, choose which modifier to use from that card. Then choose an additional challenge icon to resolve for this test.

name: Novice Lens
text: Response: After you perform a test in which you committed 1 or more manifestation, gain 1 [FOC]. Response: When you rest, if you have 1 or more [FOC] in your energy pool, scout 1 challenge card.

name: Rod of the Clouds
text: Conduit. Setup. Response: Before you draw a challenge card, name a challenge icon; if that icon is on the drawn card, add 1 vision to this conduit. Exhaust (use X visions): Scout X Ranger cards.

name: Harmonize
text: Manifestation. Attach to a being within reach of any Ranger. Response: After a challenge effect on the attached being resolves, the Ranger that played this card gains 1 energy of any type.

name: Seen Through Cycles
text:
Manifestation. <f>(To play a manifestation, discard 1 token from a conduit.)</f>
Choose a being in play, and shuffle it into the path deck. Then search the path deck and discard for a being and put it into play.

name: Scepter of Harmony
text: Conduit. Setup. Response: After you perform a test in which no challenge effects were resolved, add 1 song to this conduit. Exhaust (use X songs): Add X[progress] to a being.

name: Insightful
flavor: From a place beyond your perception, the thought arrives, and you feel a sense of peace in clarity, sure of the best path forward.
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue to add it back into your hand.

name: Vigilant
text: The number of [conflict] on this attribute is equal to the number of [AWA] in your energy pool.
flavor: Your senses heighten and you become aware of every movement and every sound. Time itself seems to slow as you toil unerringly at your task.

name: Perceptive
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, gain 1 [AWA].
flavor: The world comes to life as you perceive every detail of your surroundings: the gentle sway of grass in the bloom-scented breeze, the melodic buzz of insects in the forest, and the reflected light of the sun as it gives shape to all within your vision.

name: Thorough
flavor: As you put your mind to your task, your every movement carries meaning, and each step is made with care and intention. No detail escapes your notice. You've accounted for every outcome and planned contingencies should you fall short of your visualized result.

name: Passionate
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue to add it back into your hand.
flavor: You are gifted with an unquenchable fire that burns within. While at times it lies dormant, the proper tinder can coax it to life, and in those moments, you shine brightly on all those around you.

name: Balanced
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue to gain 1 energy of any type.
flavor: As you move in rhythm with your surroundings, your mind clears, refreshed by deep breaths of sweet air and the resonant beating of your heart.

name: Determined
text: The number of [exploration] on this attribute is equal to the number of [FIT] in your energy pool.
flavor: Your goal in sight, you draw upon a deep well of inner strength. Your limbs surge with energy, and you know with certainty that there is nothing you cannot accomplish.

name: Bold
flavor: In your many years of experience, you've found the chattering mind to be the greatest obstacle to achieving one's goals. While some overcomplicate the world with indecision and doubt, you simply act and find success.

name: Meticulous
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue to add it back into your hand.
flavor: You take tremendous joy in exploring the fine details of a task. To you, there is no action worth taking that cannot be seen through to perfection.

name: Versatile
text: Before you commit this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue. If you do, this attribute gains [reason] [exploration] [conflict].
flavor: Ever since you were young you've found that no skill lies outside of your understanding. As a result, you're not afraid to try anything at least once.

name: Inventive
text: The number of [reason] on this attribute is equal to the number of [FOC] in your energy pool.
flavor: While the minds of others may find comfort in following traditional paths, yours is at its best when it breaks away, forging new routes through the wilderness of thought.

name: Astute
flavor: The problem takes shape in your mind like a multifaceted jewel, each vertex a possible solution. The swiftest gleams in the light of your attention, and soon the gem is but a single line, the edge of a razor, the way forward as undeniable and alluring as that sharpened blade.

name: Persuasive
text: After you succeed at a test in which you committed this attribute, you may suffer 1 fatigue to add it back into your hand.
flavor: As you give voice to your intention, you do so from a place of love, so that there may be no misconstruing your desire for a specific outcome as anything other than a desire for peace and understanding.

name: Thoughtful
text: You may commit this attribute to any Ranger's test.
flavor: You have the gift of being able to sense the needs of those around you. Instinctively, you lend a hand without being overbearing, your ego nowhere to be found.

name: Engaging
text: The number of [connection] on this attribute is equal to the number of [SPI] in your energy pool.
flavor: As you fully inhabit yourself, you feel a oneness with the flow of life. Those around you are buoyed by the energy of your presence, inspired by your certainty, and happy to help in whatever way they can.

name: Compassionate
flavor: You open your heart and feel your consciousness settle into your chest. A great warmth spreads within you as you let fall any armor that may unnecessarily hinder this, the truest of connections, oneself laid bare to another.

name: Lynx Fur Cloak
text: Exhaust: When you would suffer 1 or more fatigue from a path card, reduce the amount of fatigue suffered to 0.
flavor: Let this cloak serve as a reminder that no life can be taken without consequence. Each of us, great and small, are woven into the tapestry of existence, and no thread may be pulled without harm being done.

name: Scuttler Tunnel
text: [FOC] + [exploration]: Navigate the winding tunnel to move your [ranger] to this feature. Response: When you perform a test, if your [ranger] is on this feature, add 1[harm] to it to dodge each card in the same area. Clear [harm]: If your [ranger]is on this feature, suffer 1 injury.

name: Kordo's Instinct
text: Search the path deck for a card and place it on top or bottom of the deck.
flavor: Kordo has imparted to you the wisdom of his years in the wilderness, tracking predators and dangerous biomelds in the name of protecting the balance of nature and the lives of the people he loves.

name: Sil's Sketchbook
text: Exhaust (use X sketches): Exhaust a path card with presence X. [AWA] + [reason]: Sketch [X] your subject to choose a path card and add X sketches to this book. X is equal to that card's presence.

name: Light As a Feather
text:
Manifestation.
Choose any number of path cards within reach and shuffle them into the path deck, then draw 1 path card.
flavor: Inspired by Dace's fall from the Plummet, you've learned to briefly harness the wind, allowing it to carry you short distances.

name: Kinetic Glass Sculpture
text: Exhaust (use 1 form): Exhaust and move a being.
flavor: A gift from Tollin Lang, the sculpture glitters in the sunlight. Tiny shards of glass flow and coalesce as it takes the shape of an rabbit that begins to run and leap about. It's astonishingly lifelike.

name: Reclaimer Mucus
text: Attach to a path card. Reduce the attached card's presence by 2. Response: When the attached card fatigues a Ranger, add 1[harm] to it.

name: Topographone
text: [AWA] + [reason] (use 1 graph): Calibrate the device to your current environment to scout 2 path cards for every effort.
flavor: Recovered from a crumbling ruin in the Marsh of Rebirth, this mysterious piece of Estian technology somehow scans the nearby environment and brings it to life in the palm of your hand.

name: Quiet
text: Friendly. Persistent. Unique. Exhaust: Add 3[harm] to a being and [harm] to Quiet equal to that being's presence.
flavor: The great lynx emerges from the undergrowth, silent as a shadow. She looks at you as if to say, "Today, I will not eat you. Tomorrow, however, is another day."

name: Umbral Claw
text: [FIT] + [conflict] (use 1 rake): Slash [X] with Umbra's claw to add [harm] to a being equal to your effort. If you fail, suffer 1 injury. X is equal to the being's presence. Do not resolve [crest] effects during this test.

name: Ar Tel's Vaulting Rod
text: Exhaust (use 1 vault): Exhaust an obstacle. Response: When there are no vaults on this gear, discard it. [AWA] + [conflict]: Fish [2] if there is a water card in play to soothe 2 fatigue and add 2[progress] to a water card.

name: Gauzeblade
text: [FIT] + [conflict] (use 1 fiber): Slice [X] with the fibrous blade to add [harm] to a being equal to your effort. If you fail, suffer 1 injury. X is equal to the being's presence.
flavor: This blade looks like a small bolt of cloth, but when flicked a certain way, it instantly stiffens into a razor-sharp knife.

name: Dolewood Canoe
text: Setup. You may travel on river paths. While your [ranger] is on this vehicle, treat the presence of all water features as 1 lower and the presence of all non-water features as 1 higher. [FIT] + [reason]: Board the boat to move your [ranger] to this vehicle or return it to your role.

name: The Kasende Technique
text: If you have a weapon equipped, add 5 [harm] to a being. Then suffer fatigue equal to the number of [harm] on that being in excess of its harm threshold.
flavor: After observing the precision with which Kasende dispatches hydraworms, you've learned to apply a similar measure of force when the need arises.

name: Touch of the Verdessa
text:
Manifestation. <f>(To play a manifestation, discard 1 token from a conduit.)</f>
Add 1 [harm] to a flora to add 4 [harm] or 4[progress] to a path card. If that path card is a biomeld, increase the number of [harm] or [progress] added to it by 2.

name: Tala's Perseverance
text: Add 3[progress] to a trail. If it's a mountain or obstacle, increase the number of [progress] added by 2.
flavor: Thanks to you, Tala has found a home after years of wandering in exile. In exchange, she shared with you the climbing techniques employed by her people.

name: Umbra's Shadow
text: You may move each being. Then resolve a challenge effect on a being of your choice. Resolve this effect even if the being is exhausted.
flavor: You curl your tongue and let loose a clarion whistle. Within moments, Umbra appears in the sky, and all below flee before her shadow.

name: Probability Compass
text: Use 1 needles: When a Ranger reveals a challenge card during a test, choose a modifier from that card. Spend 1 energy matching that modifier's aspect to use it for this test instead.
flavor: Silaro's gift for your hours spent delving into the darkened ruins of the Estian Arcology Complex.

name: Translocator
text: Exhaust (use 1 shift): When you perform a test, dodge each card in play. If you fail that test, suffer 1 injury.
flavor: You found this strange piece of technology left behind by a being seemingly able to disappear into thin air. Perhaps it will grant you a similar ability.

name: Silaro's Insight
text: Scout 1 path card,1 challenge card, and 1 Ranger card from each Ranger's deck.
flavor: After your many encounters with the archaeologist, Silaro Mako, you've come to understand more of the deep, complicated history of the Valley, and the role the Estians' played in its evolution.

name: Face Your Fears
text: Response: When a Ranger performs a test, commit X effort.
flavor: After spending a harrowing night with Jaris atop Greenbriar Knoll, you feel there is nothing you can't do. Fear is but a construct of the mind, a fiction with precious little basis in fact, that courage may swiftly overcome.

name: Biosign Sensor
text: Attach to a feature. Response: After the attached feature is cleared, scout X path cards. X is equal to the number of beings in play.
flavor: The sensor blinks with warms dots of light, pulsing with the heartbeat of each nearby being.

name: Dendritic Vine
text: Use 1 pulse: When you rest, scout 3 Ranger cards.
flavor: Plucked from within the terravore, this "vine" comes to life with a thought, sending branching growths over the surface of your skin, somehow enhancing your natural abilities.

name: Clarity of the Headwaters
text: Search your Ranger deck for any number of cards and place them facedown on top of your fatigue stack in the order of your choice.
flavor: You recall your exploration of the starry pool surrounding Headwaters Station and are filled with the same sense of clarity you felt in that revelatory moment.

name: Nal's Understanding
text: Add 5[progress] to a being. Then, if the being hasn't cleared, resolve each of its challenge effects in an order of your choice. Resolve these effects even if the being is exhausted.
flavor: Nal is fond of saying that the spirits are always with us, and one may speak with them as one would the oldest of friends.

name: Hy Pimpot's Secret Recipe
text: Add 1[harm] to each flora. Add X[progress] to each being. Then each ranger soothes X fatigue. X is equal to the total number of [harm] added by this card.
flavor: The complex flavors of the stew blend perfectly--rich but not overpowering, fresh but hearty, warm and soothing yet light and effervescent.

name: Philosopher's Honey
text: Exhaust (use 1 dollop): Choose a Ranger. That Ranger soothes fatigue equal to the number of [FOC] in their energy pool.
flavor: The smallest taste sends a warming sensation throughout your body. Your senses tingle as colors become more vibrant, scents more fragrant.

name: Quisi's Favorite Snack
text: Exhaust (use 1 bite): Choose a Ranger. That Ranger soothes fatigue equal to the number of [SPI] in their energy pool.
flavor: As you take a bite, you recall Quisi's endless joy and boundless curiosity, and you wonder in what corner of the Valley you might find her next.

name: Harvest Crown
text: Exhaust: When a Ranger performs a Connect test that interacts with a human, commit 2 effort.
flavor: An adornment of great honor, the harvest crown is rewarded only to those who embody the spirit of Meadow Harvest Festival, an annual tradition cherished by all those who attend.

name: Connectedness of All Things
text: Each Ranger soothes all fatigue.
flavor: You close your eyes and give thanks to the spirit of the Earth, and to the spirits of all who dwell within her nurturing embrace. You feel a deep sense of calm and of purpose, knowing that your connection to all life is eternal, a bond that even death cannot break.

name: Ranger Badge
text: Attach to your role. Exhaust (use 1 xp): Ready your role.
flavor: Calypsa's training, and her confidence in your abilities, helped you to believe in yourself, and to push beyond your perceived limitations.

name: Lingering Injury
text: Fatiguing 2 Response: When you draw this card, attach it to your role. [FIT] + [reason]: Treat [2] and bandage the injury to return this card to your collection.
